content.description:
Sit start on a good sidepull. Bump up to a slopey crimp and onto another good sidepull. Balancey move left to a crack. Right hand higher in the crack, and then to a jug. Traverse a bit further left and top out in a V-shaped part of the rock

PG-13 because if you fall on the topout (spotter or not) you're probably going to slide down a hill for a good way.
content.location:
Follow the Approach to Mr. teeth. Go around the left side of Mr. teeth and head almost immediately up and to the left. Walk up a decently steep dirt hill until you hit the boulder.

Zen Garden

is on the uphill side of the boulder

content.description: Start by standing up into the underclings on the sloping rail.
content.location: Furthest south face of rock formation that has Dr. Teeth. Has graffiti on the face.

content.description: Variation to Rabbi route. Sit start w/ left hand on undercling and right hand on polished crimp. Bump right hand to sidepull and left hand to small sloper. Right hand goes directly to gaston mono then finish the same as Rabbi.
content.location: Same boulder as Rabbi

content.description: Low sit start on two slopers opposing each other. Bump left to a good crimp then throw to a big left had pocket and then a good move to little two finger pocket up even higher. Stay on the main face and use the in-cut arete to get to the great sloper at the top to top out. Descent is a simple walk off.
content.location: Directly above Bikini Bottom in the mouth boulders.

content.description:
Start under the overhang and move out to the left. Use the crack to move back up and to the right. Match between two vertical black stripes on the rock to finish. No top out

There's a shaky looking hold towards the top of the crack but its actually solid
content.location:
Directly to the left of

High school drama

content.description:
I was unable to get a good picture but I'll go back and get a quality picture to put up

Start on the big incut jug at the edge of the cave and traverse left into the cave and finish when you've matched the starting hold of Pickles. I found this to be more fun that the original Pickles route, and you could link them and go out then back into the cave.
content.location: Same location as Pickles. Start on the big jug at the outside of the cave.

content.description: Sit start with right hand in a really deep pocket, let hand on a crimp to the left. Head up at the the right. Easy top out
content.location: Take the approach to Dr. teeth, and walk around and to the left. Follow a little path for about 20 more feet and it's on the right side. It's a few yards past a long cave things covered in grafitti

content.description:
I was unable to get a good picture but I'll go back and get a quality picture to put up

Start with you left hand on a big jug and right hand on an incut crimp next to it. Follow the fissure in the rock to the top out. The blocks to the left of the boulder are off, as are the blocks behind.
content.location: This boulder is at the opposite side of the cave that Pickles and Pickles Reverse are in.

content.description:
I was unable to get a good picture but I'll go back and get a quality picture to put up

Start about 6 feet into the cave on the north side on a good edge, albeit slightly dirty. Traverse to your right out of the cave and then scramble up the slab to the top of it. I guess you don't really HAVE to top out but it's nice and easy.
content.location: The cave is on the same rock formation as Dr Teeth and Kevorkian, it is about 30 feet uphill from Kevorkian. The route starts on a medium-sized edge about 6 feet into the north side of the cave.

content.description: Sit start with right hand in a really deep pocket, let hand on a crimp to the left. Use some decent edges and crimps to go straight up and a bit to the left.
content.location: Take the approach to Dr. teeth, and walk around and to the left. Follow a little path for about 20 more feet and it's on the right side. It's a few yards past a long cave things covered in graffiti

content.description:
Sit start with right hand in a really deep pocket, let hand on a crimp to the left. Do a fun traverse move to the deep hold on the far-left side of the boulder. Use some pokey pinches and small crimps to go straight up. There's a decent side-pull on the left that you might find useful.

The largish rocks to the left are off.
content.location: Take the approach to Dr. teeth, and walk around and to the left. Follow a little path for about 20 more feet and it's on the right side. It's a few yards past a long cave things covered in graffiti

content.description:
This thing is about as fun as a 20 foot route can get. The bottom part is thin, balancy, and crimpy. This takes you to a pretty good rest on flakes under the roof. Then prepare to make a couple super burly, insecure moves over the roof to the chains.

Using the right arete on the bottom part or the left arete at the top reduces the difficulty and fun. In other words, they're there to assist your redpoint suicide.
content.location: Around the corner to the left from Dr. Teeth, on the east side of the formation. The route gets afternoon shade.

content.description: SDS on three finger left hand pocket and a right hand on a jagged rail down low. Follow similar three finger pockets to finish the problem on the ledge. V4ish if you finish here, could make the route a little harder/PG-13 if you mantle the ledge and try to top out. If you do, you will need a spotter.
content.protection: Pad, spotter for the sloped landing
content.location: Located about 12 feet to the right of Dr. Teeth

content.description: Start on far right traverse face using crispy side pull and topout far left side
content.location: South side of rock formation with Dr. Teeth

content.description:
A very short, crimpy and balancy route on the north side of a limestone boulder.

The route starts just less than vertical and gets slightly overhanging. There are a few crimps, a couple of sidepulls and a sloper or two. Juggy holds right at the top.

There is a (very) short crack to the right of the last bolt.

Don't blow the second clip; it'd probably be painful. You can walk off the backside if you don't feel like lowering or rappelling.
content.protection: 3 bolts to chains. The chains are set back from the edge a bit so bring slings (longer than standard 24") to toprope it without dragging the rope over the edge.
content.location: Located on the north side of the 3rd large boulder up the hillside.

content.description:
I was unable to get a good picture but I'll go back and get a quality picture to put up

Start with both hands matched on the sloping rail on the far right side of the boulder. Bump your right hand to the top of the rail then move your left hand to one of a few sidepulling crimps on the upper face of the boulder. You can then make a move to the lip dynamically, or shuffle your feet up and statically reach for the top. I find the static option to be more fun. Mantel and top out. The arete of the upper half of the boulder is off.
content.location: The face of this boulder is the furthest south (uphill) side of the rock formation that Dr Teeth and Kevorkian are on. If you're looking at the boulder, the starting holds are near the bottom on the right hand side of the face.

content.description:
Start with left hand on the under-cling and right hand on what can best be described as cluster of sharp points on your fingertips. As you move to the right your feet will follow this slight lip along the bottom. If you can get more than your toes on it you off the route. This route follows a series of small 2-3 finger crimps until you reach the plant growth at the end and then start to move up the rock as soon as the first good foothold comes along. Top out to finish.

side note: this is some sharp rock... and the crimps are even sharper so make sure to bring tape cause you will end up needing it.
content.location: On final rock formation as you approach up the hill from the kevorkian (5.11b/c).

content.description: Sit start with both hands on small sharp crimps. Move to your left and up the wall with feet falling crack till you reach the bottom of the big rock on top of the Boulder. Top out to finish.
content.location: To the right of quick reflexes. maybe 15 feet to the right just as the path starts to round around the rock formation.
On one of the lower boulders on the hill, the set of boulders just bellow Dr. Teeth. You will see a slot in between two large boulders, get up to the mouth, Bikini Bottom is on the right.

content.description: Traverse in the cave, only using the west wall. Start at the end of the overhang that juts out near the middle of the cave. Top out where the cave ends or climb out.
content.location: To the left of Bikini Bottom, in the cave below to the north of rabba the r.abbi

content.description: Crux is at the start of the climb. Although the climb is rated X, the hardest part has little to now consequences if you have a crash pad and/or spotter. Once you get up and over, you traverse up and to the right to where the top out is. This is where it gets dangerous. The more you traverse, the further you can fall down. Traversing is fairly easy, fun climb for beginners to intermediates.
content.protection: You will need a crash pad
content.location: right under mr teeth. North west.

content.description: Start with hand on the small crimps almost dead center on the rail. Head up.
content.location: Far south side of rock formation that has Dr. Teeth
